content: A 100-trillion-token study by OpenRouter and A16Z indicates a paradigm shift in real-world LLM interactions towards reasoning models and increased tool invocation.
Programming has become the dominant consumer of tokens in LLM interactions, increasing from approximately 11% to over 50% of total token consumption.
Roleplay and creative dialogue are the primary uses for open-source LLMs.

Open-source models, particularly those from China, have significantly increased their market share and are now used alongside closed models, with open-source models often serving high-volume applications and closed models serving high-value applications.
The coexistence of open-source and closed models is driving the adoption of routers and wrappers for efficient model routing and persistence.
